intro: Ryticaryum ovale, commonly known as the oval false heather, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Ryticaryum ovale is often found in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cool, humid environments.
